articles.title: Greetings to Sao Tome and Principe President
Talks held between Korean and Egyptian party delegations
articles.content:
Greetings to Sao Tome and Principe President
    Pyongyang, July 12 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, President of the presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, on July 7 sent a message of greetings to Miguel Trovoada, President of Sao Tome and Principe, on the occasion of the 24th anniversary of  independence and proclamation of the Democratic Republic of Sao Tome and Principe.    The message expressed belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would strengthen and  develop and wished the president and people of Sao Tome and Principe success in their work for the prosperity of the country.

articles.title: Yang Hyong Sop meets Jordanian delegation
articles.content:
Talks held between Korean and Egyptian party delegations
    Pyongyang, July 12 (KCNA) -- Talks were held here on Sunday between the delegations of the Worker's Party of Korea (WPK) and the Egyptian National Democratic Party.   At the talks, both sides informed each other of the activities of their parties and exchanged views on further developing the friendly and cooperative relations between the two parties and on a series of issues of common concern.   Present there on the Korean side were department director of the WPK Central Committee Kim Yang Gon and officials concerned and on the Egyptian side were the members of the delegation of the Egyptian National Democratic Party headed by chairman of the parliamentary group of the party Abouzid Alfi and Egyptian ambassador to Korea Mahmoud Mohamed Farag Zain.

articles.title: Tajiks pay respects to Kim Il Sung
articles.content:
Yang Hyong Sop meets Jordanian delegation
   Pyongyang, July 12 (KCNA) -- Vice-president of the presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK Yang Hyong Sop, chairman of the Korean Social Scientists Society, met and conversed with a Jordanian delegation for the study of the Juche idea headed by chief of the Jordanian Group for the Study of the Juche Philosophy Mustafa Jaber at the Mansudae Assembly Hall on Sunday.

articles.title: Joint meeting of Pomchonghakryon held in Japan
articles.content:
Tajiks pay respects to Kim Il Sung
   Pyongyang, July 12 (KCNA) -- Leading officials of the Communist Party of Tajikistan and members of the Tajikistan-DPRK Friendship Association laid baskets of flowers before the President Kim Il Sung's Portrait at the Dushanbe Friendship Hall in Tajikistan on July 7 to pay homage to him on the occasion of the 5th anniversary of his passing away.

articles.title: U.S. senator and his party leave
World Population Day observed
articles.content:
U.S. senator and his party leave 
    Pyongyang, July 12 (KCNA) -- Robert Torricelli, U.S. senator, and his party left here on Sunday by air.

articles.title: Minju Joson hails 35th OAU summit
articles.content:
World Population Day observed
     Pyongyang, July 12 (KCNA) -- Minju Joson Sunday runs a by-lined article to commemorate the World Population Day.   Proper solution of the population issue is of importance for existence, development and welfare of humankind, the article says, and goes on:   With the satisfactory settlement of population issue Korea has no high population density in towns, unemployment, housing difficulty, increase of death rate and unfair discrimination of women.Cooperation between the DPRK and the UN Fund for Population Activities dates back to 1985. UNFPA helps  Korea in health care, education and other fields. Cooperation has recently been conducted for the sake of women, particularly, for maternity care.The scope of cooperation between the DPRK and the UNFPA increases as days go by.

articles.title: S. Korean war hawks hit for war plot
South Korean PM hints separation from ruling coalition
Kim Il Sung's whole life replete with  revolutionary optimism
articles.content:
South Korean PM hints separation from ruling coalition
    Pyongyang, July 12 (KCNA) -- The South Korean "Prime Minister," Kim Jong Pil, on July 8 openly revealed his intention to separate from the "National Congress for New Politics", enraged at the slanders of the acting "NCNP" president against the "United Liberal Democrats" and himself over the special prosecution system to be introduced against the suspected act of inducing the mint company to strike, a Seoul-based radio said.   He said in a get-together with the "ULD" presidium it is time that he was separating from the "NCNP".   Meanwhile, the floor leader of the "ULD" complained in a press conference that the acting "NCNP" president has broken up the "coalition government" by making a coward explanation over the special prosecution system.

articles.title: National Maritime day
Greetings to Nepalese Foreign Minister
articles.content:
National Maritime day
   Pyongyang, July 12 (KCNA) -- July 12 is the maritime day.   The DPRK set the day when the hydrographic bureau was formed as the National Maritime Day, and July and August as the maritime months.   Korea is a maritime country which is seabound on three sides.   To mark the day, working people, servicemen, youth and students across the country have briskly conducted various activities to prepare themselves as conquerors of sea.   And colorful sporting and cultural events are being held.   In July and August  the efforts will be made to disseminate the knowledge of sea, protect and increase the maritime resources and prevent sea pollution.   The maritime research institutes have readjusted and reinforced the material and technical means for the maritime survey, measurement and observation to intensify them. They are briskly organizing scientific forums and seminars and stepping up exchanges with institutions and organizations concerned in many countries of the world.

articles.title: Gift to Kim Jong Il from Egyptian party
articles.content:
Greetings to Nepalese Foreign Minister
   Pyongyang, July 12 (KCNA) -- Paek Nam Sun, Foreign Minister of the DPRK, sent a message of greetings to Ram Sharan Mahat upon his oppointment as Foreign Minister of the government of the Kingdom of Nepal.   The message expressed the belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would further strengthen and develop and wished him success in his work.

articles.title: Kim Ki Nam meets Egyptian party delegation
articles.content:
Gift to Kim Jong Il from Egyptian party
   Pyongyang, July 12 (KCNA) - General Secretary Kim Jong Il received a gift from the Egyptian National Democratic Party.   The gift was handed to an official concerned by head of its delegation Abouzid Alfi, chairman of its parliamentary group, on visit to the DPRK.

articles.title: Acts against Mt. Kumgang tour
articles.content:
Kim Ki Nam meets Egyptian party delegation
   Pyongyang, July 12 (KCNA) - Secretary Kim Ki Nam of the Central Committee of the Worker's Party of Korea met the visiting delegation of the Egyptian National Democratic Party led by Abouzid Alfi, chairman of the parliamentary group of the party, at the Mansudae Assembly Hall today.
